intro: Hebeandra revoluta, commonly known as the New Zealand rock hebe, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, silvery pubescence. It produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers in shades of blue or purple, typically blooming in spring. Hebeandra revoluta is well adapted to rocky and coastal environments, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun.
